content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Straightforward clash with a simple edge case (0) that keeps the problem easy but not too boring.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very quick and easy challenge, nicely done for a short CoC challenge

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and clean.

Nice one. Approved. If you have time, check mine :-) 
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/1241280a725ae09459cf17b049df1d88e25e8f
and 
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/1246892e5a6fdaad5903050adfab5fb3f20504

Other than the addition of Reverse mode, this clash has the same task as an existing clash:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/964744087fe6ce02fb0a9784bf8a98f25e6c6

I suggest to change the elements to floats for a bit of variation.

Input
* Please change "The first line contains an" to "<<Line 1>>: An".

* Please change "The second line contains" to "<<Line 2>>:".

* Please format "N" and "A" as [[variables]].

Constraints
* Please format "N" as a [[variable]].

* Please change 100 to 10, or add cases where N is greater than 10.

* Please change "A[i]" to "element in [[A]]" as "i" is undefined.

* Please reduce the range of values in the second constraint to be closer to the range actually covered in the cases, or add cases to evenly cover the range.

Cases
* Please change Test 3 to include negative elements.

* Please add cases where the input array contains 0.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback and suggestions! I’ve addressed all your points and updated the "Sum of Unique Elements (Float Edition)" puzzle accordingly.

Thank you. There are still some issues:

Constraints
* Please format "N" and "A" as [[variables]].

* Please mention that all elements in [[A]] have 1 decimal place.

Cases
* Validator 3, Test 4, Validator 4, Test 5, Validator 5 (5 cases in total): Please vary the input so that there is a good mix of different digits in the decimal place. Please also include more random negative numbers.

Thanks again.

A few more fixes should do it:
* Test 4 and Validator 4: Randomise the order of the numbers in input.

* Test 5: Please add 0.00 -13.0 -29.0 13.0 -2.9 -13.0 at the end of the input (N becomes 10, i.e. 10 elements in total).

* Validator 5: Please add -75.3 98.4 25.7 -25.7 -98.4 at the end of the input (N becomes 10, i.e. 10 elements in total).

Thanks.
